intro: Trigynaea oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed trigynaea, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Trigynaea oblongifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
